description: Hindi हौदा (haudā), from Arabic هَوْدَج‎ (hawdaj, “litter carried by a camel”) (1774).

entries.meaning: A seat, usually with a canopy, carried on the back of an elephant or camel.
examples: I shot a couple  […]  Only from the safety of a howdah, of course.

entries.meaning: An ornate carriage which is positioned on the back of elephants or occasionally other animals, used most often in the past for rich people who travelled in India via elephant.
